title: IL Sparta
text:
IL Sparta is a <a href="Sports%20club">multi-sport club</a> from <a href="Sarpsborg">Sarpsborg</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>. The club was founded on 23 November 1928, and today it has sections for <a href="association%20football">football</a> and <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a>. While the club have had a football department since the foundation, the ice hockey department was founded in 1959. The club has previously also been playing <a href="bandy">bandy</a>.
Sparta is regarded as one of the big clubs of Norwegian ice hockey, having played in the top division uninterrupted since 1980, and having won the Norwegian ice hockey championship three times (1984, 1989 and 2011) as well as four regular-season titles. Sparta's football department enjoyed its best run in the 1950s when the club played nine seasons in the top division and won the <a href="Norwegian%20Football%20Cup">Norwegian Cup</a> in <a href="1952%20Norwegian%20Football%20Cup">1952</a>, but currently plays in the lower divisions.
Ice hockey.
Sparta's <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> department is officially named "Ishockeyklubben Sparta Sarpsborg", but is promoted under the name <a href="Sparta%20Warriors">Sparta Warriors</a>. The club became Norwegian champions in 1984 and 1989, and won <a href="GET-ligaen">Eliteserien</a> in <a href="1983%E2%80%9384%20Norwegian%201.%20Divisjon%20season">1984</a>, <a href="1985%E2%80%9386%20Norwegian%201.%20Divisjon%20season">1986</a>, <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20GET-ligaen%20season">2009</a> and <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20GET-ligaen%20season">2011</a>. Sparta was the first sports-club in Norwegian history to bankrupt in 1995, withdrew from Eliteserien and restarted at the lowest tier of Norwegian ice hockey. Sparta have in the recent years had the highest average home attendance of the Norwegian ice hockey clubs, with the local derbies against <a href="Stjernen%20Hockey">Stjernen</a> having the highest attendance throughout the season.
Sparta also fields a women's team, which was Norwegian champions in 2009
Football.
Sparta's <a href="association%20football">football</a> department is officially named "Fotballklubben Sparta Sarpsborg", which has been its name since 2004. The club won the <a href="Norwegian%20Football%20Cup">Norwegian Cup</a> in <a href="1952%20Norwegian%20Football%20Cup">1952</a>, having scored all the five goals in the final against <a href="Solberg%20SK">Solberg</a> which Sparta won 3-2. Sparta played in <a href="Hovedserien">Hovedserien</a> from the start in <a href="1948%E2%80%9349%20Norwegian%20Main%20League">1948–49</a> until <a href="1957%E2%80%9358%20Norwegian%20Main%20League">1957–58</a>, only interrupted by one season at the second tier. In the ten seasons at the top tier the average attendance differed between 1300 and 5000. After decades in the lower divisions, Sparta secured promotion to <a href="Adeccoligaen">Adeccoligaen</a> in <a href="2005%20Norwegian%20Second%20Division">2005</a>, with a 15-0 win against <a href="IF%20Fram%20Larvik">Fram Larvik</a> on 22 October 2005. Ahead of the 2008 season Sparta withdrew their team and gave place to the new club called <a href="Sarpsborg%2008%20FF">Sarpsborg 08</a>. Sparta is currently playing in the fourth division, having won promotion from the fifth division in 2010.
